Merged to trunk and 0.11.0.

I'm going to merge this as is since it improves over what we have at the moment. However, I've learned via my protocol API integration test that we don't handle certain invalid AccessControlEntrys the way it was probably intended. The broker fails during deserialization and disconnects the client. Fixing requires changing the protocol classes, so I will submit that as a separate PR.

cc @cmccabe.

I ran the transactions system tests last night and we're looking good: http://confluent-kafka-branch-builder-system-test-results.s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/2017-06-17--001.1497703753--hachikuji--KAFKA-5435-ALT--49205c7/report.txt. I will go ahead and merge this to trunk and  0.11.0.

@hachikuji, maybe you can review this one liner.

Even though I tested this and it worked fine in IntelliJ, I saw the following:

https://github.com/gradle/gradle/issues/2315

Given the above, we should probably wait a while to avoid regressions.
This is contributed as of https://github.com/apache/kafka-site/pull/49. Please make sure the contributor is set to its author when merging. cc @gwenshap @ijuma
Also added the changes made in https://github.com/apache/kafka-site/pull/18/files.

I tweaked the log4j entries a bit more after running some example code while watching the different levels of log4j outputs closely. Specifically I decided to make the periodic committing as well as per-user-requested committing information still at INFO level (cc @mjsax ), while changing some internal partition assignor information from INFO to DEBUG.
@ijuma @rhauch wouldn't it be useful having this merged for the 0.11.0.0 release ? I have just see the vote for the RC1 this morning. What do you think ?

But the fix LGTM, thanks for the contribution @ppatierno!

> Making a copy is important as we can run into deadlocks if the user synchronizes on the received map.  Someone actually reported one such issue.

Closing this one because of reasons @ijuma gave us. If someone will find it useful please reopen it again. Thanks
